intro: Ceanothus grandiflorus, commonly known as the California lilac, is a shrub native to the western United States. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of fragrant, violet-blue flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it well-suited for Mediterranean climates. Its rapid growth and ability to fix nitrogen make it an important plant in ecological restoration projects. The leaves are aromatic and can be used in traditional herbal remedies.
